instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message: This 2015 Air board generates all power rails, Vcore, <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. Fan spins but does not POST, chime, or start up. The only abnormal signals I noticed are <SIGNAL>SMC_PROCHOT</SIGNAL> = 3.4 and <SIGNAL>CPU_PROCHOT_L</SIGNAL> = 0. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3 V. I have no history on the machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message: Tried a known good BIOS chip (clean ME region). No improvement. Fan spins, then stops, then continues spinning without POST.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Inspect board for corrosion.
Check it outside of shell, only charger and USB device for test.
Do not connect LIO flex, nor SSD and airport card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message: Close inspection revealed a tiny speck of corrosion on one corner of the SMC. Anything I can do to the SMC that doesn't involve replacing or reballing it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message:
Reball is necessary, always when corrosion is detected close.
You can try reflow, may just help temporary; just to detect the issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with all power rails but no POST
threads.message: Ok, I did a reflow with flux and the board starts up and works now. Will test long-term to see if the issue is fixed.
